intro: Pterocaulon alopecuroides var. polystachyum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed pterocaulon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
